Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Erosion
Identified Issue: Erosion rills or slumping
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Grass vegetation has established on east approach slope. No new evidence of soil erosion was observed.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Erosion
Identified Issue: Erosion rills or slumping
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Grass vegetation continues to establish in localized areas of low grass establishment on the east approach slope. Only minor soil erosion (rilling) was observed in 2011.
Implemented or Recommended Measures to R: Monitor in spring 2012 for evidence of soil erosion and low grass establishment and reseed where warranted.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Erosion
Identified Issue: Erosion rills or slumping
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Gully erosion was repaired in 2010, no new erosion observed.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Erosion
Identified Issue: Erosion rills or slumping
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: All ESC measures installed in 2010 are functioning as planned, minor rilling was observed between coir logs as vegetation is slow to establish in these areas.
Implemented or Recommended Measures to R: Monitor in spring 2012 for evidence of soil erosion and low grass establishment and reseed where warranted.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Erosion
Identified Issue: Erosion rills or slumping
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: No evidence of new water erosion was observed in the gully in 2011. The vertical walls of the gully have begun to slough-in and grass vegetation is establishing.
Implemented or Recommended Measures to R: Reduce the slope of the gully walls using hand tools and reseed in spring 2012.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Erosion
Identified Issue: Erosion rills or slumping
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Grass vegetation has established on the area to the west and adjacent the watercourse channel where sheet erosion was previously observed.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Erosion
Identified Issue: Erosion rills or slumping
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Grass vegetation has established on the area where rill erosion was previously observed.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Erosion
Identified Issue: Erosion rills or slumping
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: At the time of the PCM survey, grass and woody vegetation were establishing well below the access road area where previous tension cracks were observed along the arm of Hargreaves Hill above the Fraser River.
Implemented or Recommended Measures to R: Approximately 180 willow, spruce and cedar plants were installed below the access road along the arm of Hargreaves Hill following the completion of earthworks in summer 2011. Monitor for erosion and vegetation establishment in 2012.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Erosion
Identified Issue: Erosion rills or slumping
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Grass and forb vegetation were establishing well following earthworks and reseeding in 2010 to repair soil disturbance (rilling, cattle pugging and rutting). It appears cattle use was restricted in 2011. Only a few small, localized areas of low vegetation establishment were observed in 2011.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Erosion
Identified Issue: Erosion from slope onto edge of the Railway access road
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Only minor sedimentation was observed at the edge of the Railway access road.
Implemented or Recommended Measures to R: Sediment controls will be established at select locations in addition to seeding to encourage vegetation establishment in Spring 2012, where warranted.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Erosion (cont'd)
Identified Issue: Erosion of watercourse banks
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: At the time of PCM survey, erosion was observed at 458.15 and 461.5.
Implemented or Recommended Measures to R: Adjacent the 461.5 watercourse, approximately 240 alder, willow, spruce and cedar plants along with native grass seed were installed following earthworks in summer 2011. Monitor for erosion and vegetation establishment in 2012. Kinder Morgan has proposed remedial earthworks at the 458.15 watercourse in 2012. Prior to earthworks, riparian vegetation will be salvaged where feasible and replaced along with native grass seed installation following earthworks.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Trench Subsidence
Identified Issue: Sunken Trench
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Grass vegetation was establishing well following earthworks in 2010.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Lowering of topsoil or root zone material capability through improper topsoil or root zone material/subsoil handling
Identified Issue: Potential for soil mixing due to incorrect storage
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Grass vegetation establishing well.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Lowering of topsoil or root zone material capability through improper topsoil or root zone material/subsoil handling
Identified Issue: Potential for soil mixing due to subsoil spilling on topsoil or root zone material
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Grass vegetation establishing well.
Implemented or Recommended Measures to R: Monitor for grass vegetation establishment between KL 460.5 to KL 460.8 only in 2012.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Lowering of topsoil or root zone material capability through improper topsoil or root zone material/subsoil handling
Identified Issue: Potential for soil mixing due to sand spilling on topsoil or root zone material
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Grass vegetation has establishing well at 354.25 to 354.3.
Implemented or Recommended Measures to R: Monitor for improved grass vegetation establishment at 349.15 to 349.2 and 382.6 only in 2012.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Lowering of topsoil or root zone material capability through improper topsoil or root zone material/subsoil handling
Identified Issue: Potential for soil mixing due to sand spilling on topsoil or root zone material
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Grass vegetation has established on the area observed in 2010 with low grass establishment.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Lowering of topsoil or root zone material capability through improper topsoil or root zone material/subsoil handling
Identified Issue: Potential for soil mixing during ditching
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Grass vegetation has established on the areas observed in 2010 with low grass establishment.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Lowering of topsoil or root zone material capability through improper topsoil or root zone material/subsoil handling
Identified Issue: Potential for soil mixing during backfilling
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Grass vegetation has established on the area observed in 2010 with low grass establishment.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Lowering of topsoil or root zone material capability through improper topsoil or root zone material/subsoil handling
Identified Issue: Potential for soil mixing during backfilling (cont'd)
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Grass vegetation has established on the area observed in 2010 with low grass establishment.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Lowering of topsoil or root zone material capability through improper topsoil or root zone material/subsoil handling
Identified Issue: Potential soil mixing due to rutting
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: See "Physical Environment - Erosion" for comments

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Lowering of topsoil or root zone material capability through improper topsoil or root zone material/subsoil handling
Identified Issue: Potential for poor vegetation establishment due to rutting
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Vehicle tire rutting was observed and low grass establishment.
Implemented or Recommended Measures to R: Raked out ruts and seeded with native grass seed again in 2011 and fenced area to discourage vehicle use in this area, monitor in 2012 for vegetation establishment

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Contaminated sites
Identified Issue: Potential for contamination due to chemical dust suppression
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Grass and woody vegetation was establishing.
Implemented or Recommended Measures to R: Recontoured subsoil to match the grade adjacent the disturbance, replaced topsoil, installed native grass seed and coniferous and deciduous plants. Irrigated installed plants and sprayed for weeds. Monitor in 2012 for vegetation establishment.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Contaminated sites (cont’d)
Identified Issue: Potential for contamination due to chemical dust suppression (cont’d)
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Grass establishment on the majority of the yard is progressing well, approximately three localized areas of low grass establishment were observed.
Implemented or Recommended Measures to R: Monitor localized areas of low grass vegetation establishment in 2012.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Loss or alteration of rare plant communities
Identified Issue: Disturbance of rare plants communities
Location(s) (KL/KP): See Environmental Work Sheets for locations
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: See Section 2.3.2 for discussion.
Implemented or Recommended Measures to R: Continue PCM for vegetation establishment

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Loss or alteration of rare vascular plants
Identified Issue: Loss of rare vascular plants
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Monitoring by rare plant specialists was conducted in summer 2011. Mitigation undertaken during construction was determined to be unsuccessful for these plants in 2011 and no further mitigation is required.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Loss or alteration of rare nonvascular plants
Identified Issue: Loss of rare nonvascular plants
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Monitoring by rare plant specialists was conducted in summer 2011. Mitigation undertaken during construction was determined to be unsuccessful for these plants in 2011 and no further mitigation is required.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Disturbance to Haller's apple moss
Identified Issue: Bartramia halleriana, COSEWIC and SARA-listed species
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: 120 large trees (coniferous and deciduous) and a jute screen (located on the west side of the population) were installed adjacent the Haller’s Apple Moss population in spring 2011 and fall 2010 respectively, at the request of the Haller's Apple Moss Recovery Team. The large trees, in addition to the smaller trees, shrubs and grass vegetation that were installed prior to 2011, were observed establishing well. The screen located on the west side of the population was functioning as planned.
Implemented or Recommended Measures to R: Monitor in 2012 for woody and grass vegetation establishment

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Revegetation of disturbed areas
Identified Issue: Potential for unsuccessful revegetation
Location(s) (KL/KP): 337.5 to 338.1 338.1 to 339.2 Athabasca River west side
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Grass and salvaged/replanted woody riparian plants were observed establishing.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Revegetation of disturbed areas
Identified Issue: Potential for unsuccessful revegetation
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Low grass establishment was observed.
Implemented or Recommended Measures to R: Install soil retention measures and reseed at 424.9 to 424.95; monitor for vegetation establishment in 2012

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Revegetation of disturbed areas
Identified Issue: Potential for unsuccessful revegetation
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Localized areas of low vegetation establishment were observed adjacent the facility fencing, and within open areas adjacent the pump station and access road.
Implemented or Recommended Measures to R: Reseed areas of low vegetation establishment in spring 2012. Monitor for vegetation establishment in summer/fall 2012

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Revegetation of disturbed areas
Identified Issue: Potential for unsuccessful revegetation
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Localized areas of low vegetation establishment were observed adjacent the facility fencing.
Implemented or Recommended Measures to R: Reseed areas of low vegetation establishment in spring 2012. Monitor for vegetation establishment in 2012

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Revegetation of disturbed areas
Identified Issue: Woody plant damage due to mowing
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: The majority of woody riparian vegetation that was inadvertently mowed by a third party contractor in the summer of 2010, resumed growth in 2011. 200 addition willow plants were installed and irrigated in 2011. All vegetation was observed establishing well.
Implemented or Recommended Measures to R: Monitor in 2012 for the establishment of woody vegetation installed in 2011

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Native grass/forb/woody plant re-establishment
Identified Issue: Small, localized areas of low grass establishment
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Grass vegetation has established on the majority of the areas observed in 2010 with low grass establishment.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Native grass/forb/woody plant re-establishment
Identified Issue: Small, localized areas of low grass establishment
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Low to moderate grass establishment was observed at select sites.
Implemented or Recommended Measures to R: Localized areas will be monitored in spring 2012 and reseeded as warranted. Seeded areas will be monitored in 2012 for vegetation establishment

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Native grass/forb/woody plant re-establishment
Identified Issue: Sites with low forb or woody plant establishment
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: 460 silver berry plants were installed at 336.85 in 2011. All vegetation was observed establishing well.
Implemented or Recommended Measures to R: Monitor in 2012 for the establishment of woody vegetation installed in 2011

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Native grass/forb/woody plant re-establishment
Identified Issue: Sites with low forb or woody plant establishment
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Grass vegetation was observed establishing well at 373.8.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Native grass/forb/woody plant re-establishment
Identified Issue: Sites with low forb or woody plant establishment
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Approximately 150 willow stakes where installed at the banks of the 354.1 crossing in fall 2010. The majority (~80%) of willow stakes were observed establishing in 2011.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Native grass/forb/woody plant re-establishment (cont’d)
Identified Issue: Sites with low forb or woody plant establishment (cont’d)
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: All vegetation located adjacent to the channel banks was observed establishing well.
Implemented or Recommended Measures to R: The watercourse at 458.15 will be reconstructed in 2012. Woody plants will be salvaged prior to channel reconstruction and replaced immediately following the completion of earthworks.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Native grass/forb/woody plant re-establishment (cont’d)
Identified Issue: Identification and treatment of weeds in the Project area
Location(s) (KL/KP): See Appendix A for right-of-way locations

Implemented or Recommended Measures to R: Weed control completed. Monitor in 2012 for weed spread or establishment and treat as necessary

Identified Issue: Potential spread of forest health pathogens
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Forest health management is considered complete.

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Acceleration of the spread of forest health pathogens
Identified Issue: Beetle infected trees located
2011 Post-Construction Observations and/: Forest health factors monitoring/sanitation procedures outlined in Appendix C will be implemented in winter/spring 2012 where beetle infested spruce or Douglas-fir windthrow were identified in 2011.
Implemented or Recommended Measures to R: Monitor spruce and Douglas-fir windthrow only

Potential Adverse Environmental Effect: Disturbance to off right-of-way areas
